item.title: Report E-2024050093
item.description:
Report E-2024050093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The leaking container was discovered when moving the container from a trailer onto the dock at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA. Further investigation revealed the source of the leak was that the container had cracked due to deterioration/aging. The spill was remediated and the container was overpacked into a 13H4 container for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report E-2024050032
item.description:
Report E-2024050032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft and 10ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) pound of material was released due to three (3) plastic bags being ripped by the trailer wall. Miller Environmental Group personnel recovered the released material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050027
item.description:
Report E-2024050027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that seven (7) ounces of material was released due to a loose cap on one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Miller Environmental Group personnel tightened the cap and used absorbent pads to clean the drum and then deployed granular absorbent and a neutralizer to the impacted area. The spent material was recovered and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The 55-gallon poly drum was then shipped on to the consignee. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050053
item.description:
Report E-2024050053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: CARNEGIE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1121 Hrs. on 4-21-2024, the WLE Rook Yard Conductor found tank car NATX 318056 leaking from the manway on top the car. He called the WLE Yardmaster who then contacted myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. I called Specialized Professional Services out of Washington, PA to go look at the car. They determined that the manway was indeed leaking. The found that the bolts were tight. They opened the lid and found that the seal looked new and that there was not any compression markings at the point of the manway safety bolts. They felt that the safety bolts did not have enough threads on them to tighten to the point that the gasket would compress. The installed a nozzle gasket, to replace the ring gasket, and then was able to get the lid to tighten fully. I had suggested to them that maybe the manway lid was improperly positioned on the nozzle causing the metal of the lid to hit the metal of the nozzle, thereby not letting the lid close tightly. They said they did not check for that and therefore could not confirm that idea. They closed the lid, tightened the bolts and installed new seal # 8418988 on the manway lid. They had also checked for leaks in the Roll Over Protection Housing but found none and then installed new seal 8418983 on that lid. The car was then released for service and after the car was moved, there was no leak noticed.

item.title: Report X-2024050082
item.description:
Report X-2024050082

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DR 23 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISSION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
